result.execSummary:
All charges against Sharon E. Hart in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sharon E. Hart is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sharon E. Hart

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF247 & 22CM14 (STC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Matthew Dobbe   DF:  Sharon E. Hart appeared. Case called at 2:12 p.m. Court notes these matters are set for a status conference. There is a resolution. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 2 & 3 Misd. Bail Jumping in 22CF247. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct' 2 & 3 Misd. Bail Jumping in 22CF247. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 1 & 4 in 22CF247 and 22CM14 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal. Court will reserve on jail credit at this time. Court adjourned at 2:28 p.m. 

Crt orders:
In Ct. 2:
- S/W 1 year Probation. Report to Probation no later than 9 a.m. on 06/16/22. Run concurrent to Ct. 3.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Court costs of $243.00. Bond on file to apply. Remaining to be set up on a payment plan. $20.00 per month beginning July 15. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety.
- Random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
- Contact with Naihla B. to be determined by the Agent.

In Ct. 3:
- S/W 1 year Probation. Report to Probation no later than 9 a.m. on 06/16/22. Run concurrent to Ct. 2.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Court costs of $243.00. Bond on file to apply. Remaining to be set up on a payment plan. $20.00 per month beginning July 15. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety.
- Random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
- Contact with Naihla B. to be determined by the Agent.
Status conference on June 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CM14 & 22CF247 (PTC):
CO: RMW , REP: Kathy Malsom via zoom CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Matthew Dobbe   DF:  Sharon E. Hart appeared. Case called at 2:39 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a pre trial conference. There is a resolution. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement.  Court will recess at 2:42 p.m. for DE and Attorney to speak. Case recalled at 3:06 p.m. Atty Dobbe states DE is not prepared to plea today. Requesting matter be rescheduled. DE states currently homeless. Phone updated. Court adjourned at 3:08 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Matthew Dobbe   DF:  Sharon E. Hart appeared. Case called at 2:58 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a pre trial conference. Atty Dobbe was just appointed on this matter. Has not received discovery. Requesting another status. DE does have another pending file in Branch 1. Court notes a speedy trial demand was made at the initial appearance. DE is out of custody. Atty Dobbe states DE is withdrawing speedy trial demand. Court schedules. ADA Rockow states discovery was mailed out today. Also notes DE has not reported to JSC per bond in Branch 1 file. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 3:04 p.m.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for Discovery and Inspection and Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Dobbe. km
Appointing Atty Dobbe. km
Per RMW. arc
Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Naihla B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Abrianna Dolfi   DF:  Sharon E. Hart appeared from jail via video. Court notes warrant was issued based on non appearance in March. DE has a copy of complaint today. Did not get prior notice of courtdate.  Address and DOB confirmed. Understands charges and penalties. Atty Dippolito waives further reading. Enters NG plea. Qualifies for PD representation. Requesting a no abusive contact. ADA Ellenwood gives bond argument. States there is a no contact order in place on another bond. Atty Dippolito requesting a speedy date. There is a conflict with the PD's office. Court notes speedy trial demand was made. Court QUASHES WARRANT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
